name: Courtyard Surfaces ITP
Waterproofing
Confirm area of work is accessible & acceptable to commence (If not comment below)
Setout & alignment as per drawing (include revision below)
Drawing & revision number(s)
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Attach relevant photos below
Membrane system & methodology checked off AGainst Aland standard
Surface preparation as per application guide
Substrate clean, dry & free from dust
Ensure no high points or crevices are in the substrate
Ensure substrate is structurally sound & ready to receive membrane
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer
HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Ensure all floor wastes & pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
(PrimeSeal MC to all surfaces at a rate of 3?4m2/Ltr ?Alternative primers Multiseal ? Primeseal SP at a rate of 5?8 m2/Ltr)
All corners, joints, gaps & cracks to be treated with a flexible polyurethane sealant resiflex FC
Apply selected Membrane as per datasheet & application guidelines Ensure sealant has fully cured before installing membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
First coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per DURAM recommendations
Note A total dry film thickness of min 12mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats As such at min
Wet Film Thickness of min 075mm (750 microns) per coat is required ? Apply membrane at a coverage of 075 ? 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
Allowing the membrane coat to dry min 12 hours check the tackiness before applying next coat
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to second coat
Second coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per DURAM recommendations
Note ? a total dry film thickness of min 12mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats As such at min
Wet Film Thickness of min 075mm (750 microns) per coat is required ? Apply membrane at a coverage of 075 ? 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
The membrane is to be applied in a minimum of 2 coats at a total coverage of 12 to 2 litres per m2 or relevant product TDS 12 to 2 litres per m2 or relevant product TDS
Allow 2nd coat of Multithane UV min 12 hours but no longer than 24 hours before installing Multithane ATC top coat
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to final coat
Apply final coat of Multithane ATC at a coverage rate of 3 ? 4 m2/ltr
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instrument
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
Surface Finish & Sign Off
Wastes installed correctly to specification (Correct height / level/ location)
Waterproofer pushes sponge down 100mm and finishes his membrane & flood test
Waterproofer removes sponge and releases water and puts the sponge back in ensuring there are no debris left in the pipe
Aland cleans and removes the sponge
Waterproofing membrane completed and ready for Pebble Washed Aggregate topper
Pebble surface installed to specification(s) - Correct level and finish
Attach photos /comments below
Final Sign Off - All courtyard works completed to specification and as per above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
